DataElement.preferredName: Biospecimen Tissue Transfer Operating Room To Gross Pathological Examination Room Biospecimen Pre-analytical Variables Program Standard Operating Procedure Name Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The name of the SOP governing the transport of tissue from the operating room to the pathology gross room.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Biospecimen Tissue Transfer Operating Room To Gross Pathologic Examination Room Biospecimen Pre-analytical Variables Program Standard Operating Procedure
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products._An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function._The act of conveying or transporting from one place to another._A room in a health care facility equipped for the performance of surgical operations and procedures._Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement._An assessment of macroscopic pathological findings that are caused by disease._An area within a building enclosed by walls and floor and ceiling._A program designed to systematically investigate the effects of individual pre-analytical factors on the molecular profiles of biospecimens. The results of this study will be used to develop evidence-based protocols and best practices for optimal collection, processing, and storage of biospecimens._An established procedure to be followed in carrying out a given operation or in a given situation.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Concepts.definition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Property.preferredName: Tissue Transfer Operating Room To Gross Pathologic Examination Room Biospecimen Pre-analytical Variables Program Standard Operating Procedure
Property.preferredDefinition: An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function.:The act of conveying or transporting from one place to another.:A room in a health care facility equipped for the performance of surgical operations and procedures.:Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.:An assessment of macroscopic pathological findings that are caused by disease.:An area within a building enclosed by walls and floor and ceiling.:A program designed to systematically investigate the effects of individual pre-analytical factors on the molecular profiles of biospecimens. The results of this study will be used to develop evidence-based protocols and best practices for optimal collection, processing, and storage of biospecimens.:An established procedure to be followed in carrying out a given operation or in a given situation.

Concepts.definition: An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function.
The act of conveying or transporting from one place to another.
A room in a health care facility equipped for the performance of surgical operations and procedures.
Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.
An assessment of macroscopic pathological findings that are caused by disease.
An area within a building enclosed by walls and floor and ceiling.

A program designed to systematically investigate the effects of individual pre-analytical factors on the molecular profiles of biospecimens. The results of this study will be used to develop evidence-based protocols and best practices for optimal collection, processing, and storage of biospecimens.
An established procedure to be followed in carrying out a given operation or in a given situation.
